questions.question: An image is produced in a mirror because light from an object that strikes a mirror –

choices.answer: Bounces off the mirror in straight lines
Is absorbed by the glass in the mirror
Adds heat energy to the mirror
Bends as it passes through the mirror

questions.question: Students can demonstrate reflection by doing which of the following?

choices.answer: Enlarging an image using a hand lens
Measuring a shadow made by the Sun
Warming metal under a heat lamp
Observing their own image in a calm lake

questions.question: This pencil in a glass of water appears to be broken, but it's not. This is because light –

choices.answer: is scattered by water molecules
bounces off the water’s surface
bends when it moves from water to air
always travels in straight lines

questions.question: The illustration shows a light ray striking an object. The light striking the object is –

choices.answer: absorbed
reflected
stopped
refracted

questions.question: Which of the following materials would reflect the most light?

choices.answer: A flat sheet of aluminum foil
A dark brown carpet square
A smooth, black-topped table
A piece of red construction paper

questions.question: Why does the light passing through a hand lens make the image of the penny appear larger?

choices.answer: Because the light is absorbed.
Because the light is refracted.
Because the light is reflected.
Because the light is stopped.

questions.question: Why can you see a mirror image of the tree in the pond?

choices.answer: Because light striking the water is absorbed.
Because light striking the water bounces off.
Because light striking the water bends downward.
Because light striking the water becomes brighter.

questions.question: One box is painted black and another is painted white.  The white box looks brighter because-

choices.answer: more light is reflected off white paint.
more light is refracted by white paint.
more light passes through white paint.
more light is absorbed by white paint.

questions.question: What best describes how the objective lens of this telescope helps us observe the moon?

choices.answer: The objective lens produces light.
The objective lens reflects light.
The objective lens blocks light.
The objective lens refracts light.

questions.question: When light travels through a prism, it bends and separates colors. How else does the happen?

choices.answer: When light moves through air into water.
When light hits a wall.
When light passes through outer space.
When light hits a mirror.
